task_summary: Robot pours contents from a cup into a mug using a coordinated grasp, alignment, and pouring motion as observed in the frames.

task_long_description.overview: This episode documents a 6-DoF robotic arm tasked with pouring liquid from a cup into a mug. The workspace features a wooden table, a source cup held by the robot, and a mug as the pouring target. The robot must detect both objects, stably grasp the cup, align above the mug, and perform the pouring gesture by tilting the cup, before retreating to a neutral position. No human interaction is present; the task depends on visual feedback and precise actuation.
preconditions: Cup available on table or held by robot
Mug positioned stably on work surface
Perception functioning for cup and mug
success_criteria: Cup liquid is poured into mug as intended
failure_and_recovery: Object not detected: retry detect action
Grasp not stable: attempt re-grasp (not shown in frames)
task_long_description.termination: Pour action completes and robot retreats from mug

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the mug is visible to sensors
Checks if the cup is visible
Grasps the cup using a side grasp with light force
Moves the gripped cup above the mug to prepare for pouring
Pours from cup into mug using a tilt gesture
Retreats arm by 10cm after pour is complete

recovery_strategy: Abort pour if excessive spillage detected
assumptions: Instruction referred only to 'mug' as target, but cup is present and poured as source in all frames; mapped cup as 'source' per visual evidence
Amount and pour rate not specified; set to null to match frame evidence and library constraints
Single pour motion only; no retries or feedback control evident in frames
Frames show robot already grasping cup; detect+grasp actions included for completeness

expected_success_criteria: Cup contents successfully poured into mug
Gripper releases cup only after pour (not shown in frames)
